title: Drawing, "Design for Curtains, for the Music Room or the Banqueting Room, Brighton, Royal Pavilion", 1818–19
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on wove paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Elevation of a wall, showing a design for the decoration of the five windows.  Swags of yellow and crimson drapery are upheld at the center by a flying dragon and tied at the sides by serpents. The intervening piers between the windows are covered by fluted drapery in yellow. Cornice in blue and gold.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory
